content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, everyone is there having breakfast and Joey enters carrying a loaf of bread.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who wants French toast?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’ll have some!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good, me too. (Tosses him the loaf.) Eggs and milk are in the fridge. Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oww!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s the matter honey?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know, my hand feels weird. I guess it’s because, I’m engaged! (Shows off the ring.) How long before it starts getting annoying?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It starts?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, so let’s get started on the wedding plans!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! (Runs off.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Already?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we got a lot to do! We gotta think about the flowers, the caterers, the music…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I got some thoughts on that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wait Chandler, too many cooks…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Take it from me, as the groom all you have to do is show up and try to say the right name.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! (Sets down a huge 3” 3-ring binder on the table.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What in God’s name is that?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, the wedding book?! I haven’t seen that since the forth grade!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This baby has got everything. Take y’know, locations for instance. (She opens up the binder to the locations chapter.) First, organized alphabetically, then geographically, then by square footage.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is so smart! (To Chandler, under her breath) Break it off. Break it off now.

content.description: A Classroom, Ross is giving a lecture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that should conclusively prove that I had the idea for Jurassic Park first! Now let’s take a look at… (Phoebe rushes in.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, oh my God! Wh-wh-what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I need to talk to you, it’s pretty urgent. It’s about Monica and Chandler.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! Of course, of course. (To the class.) Umm, would you please excuse me for a moment? Umm, do you know each other’s hometowns? Why don’t you… (Motions that they should learn everyone’s hometown.) (To Phoebe) Wh-what’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, umm, not much. But, I was just thinking that since those guys just got engaged that maybe it would be nice if they had some privacy, y’know? So, could I just move in with you for a couple days?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, okay, yeah, sure. But wh-what’s wrong with Monica and Chandler?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing—Why?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, you said it was urgent!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah it is! I’m going to the movies and it starts in like five minutes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you realize I have a classroom full of students?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. I’m so rude. Does anyone want to come to the movies?

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Rachel and Monica are pretty much telling Chandler what the wedding plans are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, so I haven’t cleared the budget with my parents yet, but tell me how this is for music.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right umm, a string quartet for the procession.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A jazz trio for cocktails. The Bay City Rollers for dancing. Wait, that was from my sixth grade wedding.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you couldn’t get them anyway. Ian doesn’t play anymore and Derrick… (Off of Rachel and Monica’s looks) And Derrick is a name I shouldn’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Mon, do you have another pillow? (Holds up one.) Y’know, something a little snugglyer?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why are you napping over here instead of over at your place?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, the duck…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! The duck?! What the hell did the damn duck do now?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, well he did not get sick somewhere in there and it was immediately found and properly cleaned up!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now, do I get to look at this book or is it just for people who are actually involved in the wedding?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course you can look at it! Yeah, I want your opinion too!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here you go! What do you think about centerpieces?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Centerpieces!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! Roses or Lilies? (Holds up a picture of each.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Definitely roses. (Monica and Rachel exchange a look.) Well, I just think they’re a little more weddingy. (Monica holds the Lily picture closer to him.) But Lilies are the clear choice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! It’s like one mind.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Guys! Guys!! You gotta let me nap! Ugh, I’m gonna get cranky!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, there is a perfectly good couch across the hall!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes it is perfectly good, and it is not one of the places the duck got sick!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’m gonna go! (Gets up and heads for the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now Joey, what did the duck do?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! But he did not eat your face cream!
[Cut to Joey and Rachel’s, Joey enters and heads for his bedroom. He pushes open the door to find the duck.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey little buddy, how are you feeling? (The duck does not get sick and Joey recoils in horror and heads for the couch.) What the hell is in that face cream? (He’s about to try out the couch but notices the bed in Rachel’s room. He walks into her room and feels the bed.) That’s so soft. (He pulls back the comforter.) Pillowcases! (He climbs in and groans in delight. Suddenly, he feels something under him and pulls out a little beat up paperback book. He opens it and starts to read from it.) (In his head.) Zelda looked at the chimney sweep. Her father, the vicar… (Stops reading and thinks.) The vicar? (Continues reading) …wouldn’t be home for hours. Her loins were burning. She threw caution to the wind and reached out and grabbed his… (Out loud.) Whoa! (Reads on in silence.) Whoa-ho-ho-ho! This is a dirty book! (Continues to read.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Phoebe has moved in and has a massage client on the table she’s set up in the living room. Ross enters and is shocked to see a naked man lying on the table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Phoebe…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Ross, hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m with a client right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, let’s talk outside.
(They go into the hall.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, you can’t massage people in my apartment!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s the big deal? I did it at Monica and Chandler’s!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And they knew about it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well Ross, what is this really about?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, this is my home and I want to be able to come and go whenever I want!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I will find someplace else to do the rest of my appointments. I just don’t know what the big deal is!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The big deal is I don’t want naked, greasy strangers in my apartment when I want to kick back with a puzzle—beer! Cold beer.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is sweeping up as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Joey, what ‘cha doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sweepin’. Why? Turn you on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh. What if I was sweeping a chimney?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, did you eat my face cream?
(She walks into her bedroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where are you going? The vicar won’t be home for hours.
(She comes back out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, (nervously) where did you learn that word?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where do you think, (pause) Zelda?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You found my book?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah I did!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, what-what are you doing going into my bedroom?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, look I’m sorry, I went in there to take a nap and I know I shouldn’t have, but you got porn!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey-hey, y’know what? I don’t care! I’m not ashamed of my book. There’s nothing wrong with a woman enjoying a little…erotica. It’s just a healthy expression of female sexuality, which by the way, you will never understand. (She goes into her room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got porn!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is coming out of the living room carrying his salad and a puzzle—beer! Cold beer. And he decides to fold up Phoebe’s massage table, but being Ross has trouble with it as there is a knock on the door. He sets the table back up and opens the door to reveal a beautiful woman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi, is uh Phoebe here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh no-no, she-she’s out for the night.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Ohh great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can I, can I help you with something?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Well, I don’t know. Are you a masseur?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes I am.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Great! (Calls down the hall) Dad! (Her old father walks in.) Thank you so much, I’ll be back to pick him up in an hour. (She walks away.)
(Ross isn’t happy and closes the door slowly.)

content.description: A Restaurant, Monica and Chandler are having dinner with her parents.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: So Chandler, your parents must’ve been thrilled when you told them you were engaged.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, I should probably call them.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I remember when we first got engaged.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I don’t think I ever heard that story.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh dad, really you don’t need to…

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, I’d gotten Judy pregnant. I still don’t know how that happened.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You don’t know how that happened?! Your dog thought my diaphragm was a chew toy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What a sweet story.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, at least you’re not hearing it for the first time at your fifth grade Halloween party.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What?! They wanted a scary story!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anyway, we’re really excited about our wedding plans, and well I guess pretty soon we’ll be making a big withdrawal from the Monica wedding fund. (She and Chandler laugh, but her parents don’t.) What?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You tell her Jack, I can’t do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What happened? You still have the Monica wedding fund don’t you?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: We have it. Only now, we call it the beach house.

content.description: A Restaurant, scene continued from before the break.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t believe you spent my wedding fund on the beach house!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: We’re sorry honey, but we just assumed if you got married after you turned 30 you’d pay for it yourself.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You bought the beach house when I was 23!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Which means you had seven years of beach fun and you can’t put a price on that sweetie.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: We really do feel bad about this though.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: We started saving again when you were dating Richard and then that went to hell, so we redid the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What about when I started dating Chandler?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well it was Chandler! We didn’t think he’d ever propose!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Clearly I did not start drinking enough at the start of the meal. (Starts to make up for lost time and takes a big swig of his drink.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe it! That there is no money for my wedding?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: We might still have some money, if your father didn’t think it was a good idea to sell ice over the Internet.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: It seemed like such a simple idea.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Stupid Jack, the word is stupid.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: All right, enough! I don’t want to hear about it anymore! (Under his breath) Good luck, Chandler. (Chandler takes another drink.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, his massage client is on the table and Ross is reluctantly starting his massage. He spreads some lotion in his hands, and doesn’t like it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Now, I’m going to touch you. (He does so, very gingerly.) Ohh, that’s soft. (He starts poking him and notices his salad spoons and starts to massage him with those.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica and Chandler are returning from dinner, Rachel is already there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe this. Do you think that your parents could help pay for it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, my mother spent most of her money on her fourth wedding. She’s saving the rest for her divorce. And any extra cash my father has he saves for his yearly trips to (Pause) Dollywood .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well what happened at dinner?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My parents spent the money for our wedding!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My God! What did you order?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, but there’s no money! Well this is terrible! You guys are gonna have to get married in like a, rec. center!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, it’s gonna be okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No it’s not! It’s not gonna be okay! It sucks! No swing band! No lilies!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, y’know what? It’s gonna be okay. I mean you don’t have to have this rustic Italian feast. Y’know? And-and you don’t need, you don’t need this custom-made, empire-waisted, duchess, satin gown; you can wear off the rack. (She starts to cry, as does Monica.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, it really is gonna be okay. The important thing is that we love each other and that we’re gonna get married.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you even understand what off the rack means?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, why don’t you just pay for it yourself?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How? I don’t have any money.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I have some.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How much?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, close to… (Notices Rachel leaning in to hear and decides to write it on a piece of paper and hand it to Monica as Phoebe averts her eyes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whoa!!! Are you kidding me?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well what?! How-how much is it?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s enough for wedding scenario eight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! (Whispers.) Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How great are you, you little saver?! I mean, the-the amount you have is exactly the budget of my dream wedding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, you guys are so made for each other.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you’re not suggesting that we spend all of the money on the wedding?

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Ah, yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, come on, I’ve been saving this money for six years and I kinda had some of it earmarked for the future, not just for a party.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! (In a sultry voice) Hello, Mr. Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is the most special day of our lives.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I realize that honey, but I’m not gonna spend all of the money on one party.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, umm I-I love you, (laughs) but umm, if you call our wedding a party one more time, you may not get invited. Okay? (Laughs) Listen, we could always earn more money, okay? But uh, we’re only gonna get married once.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I understand, but I have to put my foot down. Okay? The answer is no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You-you’re gonna have to put your foot down?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I am!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, money and a firm hand. Finally a Chandler I can get on board with.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are there as Rachel enters and sees Joey sitting there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach, do you smell smoke?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh, I get it, smoke, chimney, chimney sweep, very funny, ha-ha.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no, I’m serious. You don’t smell it? Something’s on fire.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well no, I don’t smell anything.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, y’know what? It’s probably just your burnin’ loins.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what are you guys, what are you guys talking about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Damn, this coffee’s cold! Hey Rach, do you mind if I heat this up on your loins? (Joey and he both laugh.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I can not believe you told him, Joey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I guess you bought that book after we broke up huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh, yeah I did, because I wore out my first copy when I was with you. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah? Well uh, when we were going out, I read tons of porno magazines! (Realizes a table of women overheard him.) (To that table.) ‘Sup?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross! How could you do that to an old man?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me ladies. (To Phoebe) I’m sorry?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My massage client, Arthur? His daughter called and said that some guy that worked for me gave him a really weird massage this afternoon.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I gave him an extremely professional massage!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He said you poked at him with wooden spoons.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, so it wasn’t uh, a traditional massage. But I did give him acu-pressure with a pair of chopsticks. And, and I gently exfoliated him with, with a mop.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he’s never coming back! Okay? You just cost me eight dollars a week!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know what? This is your fault! You’re the one that didn’t move his-his appointment.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s my fault?! You didn’t have to massage him! You could’ve sent him away! You could’ve not rolled Tonka trucks up and down his back!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He said he liked that!! Oh you’re right, you’re right. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, what are you massaging an old man for?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: His daughter was hot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Gotcha.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is looking at the wedding book as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Listen umm, I’ve been thinking, it’s not fair for me to ask you to spend all of your money on our wedding. I mean, you work, you work really hard for that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ehh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Eh, you work for that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I thought about it too, and I’m sorry. I think we should spend all of the money on the wedding.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You do?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m putting my foot down. Yeah look, when I proposed I told you that I would do anything to make you happy, and if having the perfect wedding makes you happy then, then that’s what we’re gonna do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you’re so sweet. (They hug and kiss.) Oh, but wait, what about our, what about the future and stuff?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh, forget about the future and stuff! So we only have two kids, y’know? We’ll pick our favorite and that one will get to go to college.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You thought about that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How many kids were we gonna have?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, four, a boy, twin girls and another boy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What else did you think about?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, stuff like where’d we live, y’know? Like a small place outside the city, where our kids could learn to ride their bikes and stuff. Y’know, we could have a cat that had a bell on its collar and we could hear it every time it ran through the little kitty door. Of course, we’d have an apartment over the garage where Joey could grow old.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? I-I don’t want a big, fancy wedding.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure you do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I want everything you just said. I want a marriage.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You sure?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I love you so much.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you. (They kiss.) Hey listen umm, when, when you were talkin’ about our future you said cat, but you meant dog right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, totally!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is balancing her checkbook as Joey enters from his room wearing a hockey helmet, gloves, and shin guards.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello, Zelda.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who are you supposed to be?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The vicar!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you even know what a vicar is?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like a goalie, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Look Joey, it’s enough alright?! You keep making these stupid jokes and this sleazy innuendoes and it’s—I’m not—it’s just not funny anymore!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’m sorry. Rach I—Rach I’m sorry. Okay? I’m sorry! Maybe I can make up for it by, taking you roughly in the barn. (Giggles.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right! Y’know what? That’s it! You wanna do it?! Let’s do it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s right, I wanna do it with you! I’ve been trying to fight it, but you just said all the right things.
content.parenthetical: starting to move closer to him

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I-I-I-I did? (He puts a stool in front of her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Ohh, I’ve been waitin’ so long to get on that body!
content.parenthetical: moves the stool out of the way

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This body? (He backs into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that’s right! Come on Joey; sex me up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, you’re startin’ to sound like the butcher’s wife there in-in chapter seven.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on now, don’t keep me waiting. Get those clothes off! But, I would keep that helmet on because you’re in for a rough ride! (He backs into the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t want to, I’m scared.
(Rachel walks away, pleased with herself.)
